Post Doctoral Research Associate                                                                                    
Imperial College London , Section of Infectious Diseases & Immunity, Dept. of Medicine
•Manage and conduct clinical studies according toagreed protocol and timeline compliant
with good clinical practise(GCP) standards
•Manage and run virology lab, Conduct research and design and implement new
methodology .Write SOP and publish data obtained inresearch (including inconferences)
Scientist ( Dept. of Virology)
Merck KGaA ( at BioReliance Ltd, Glasgow) 
•Study Director :Managing and orchestrating scientific studies &providing relevant
technical, regulatory support toboth internal and external clients .
•Liaising with Quality Assurance, Project Management, Sales and Order Management teams
toensure completion ofprojects .
PhD .Medicine (Viral Immunology)
•Discovery :Potential therapeutic options tocure and prevent lung disease inthe elderly
and infants when infected with respiratory viruses such asInfluenza and RSV.
•Elucidating mechanisms ofInfluenza virus and RSV infection inthehuman lung .Work Experience HighlightsPersonal Statement
Dynamic research scientist with extensive experience inRespiratory Medicine and
Immunology looking togain experience asaMedical Science Liaison inthe healthcare
industry .
Client Interface
•Liaising with clients from Bio-pharmaceutical industry regarding development and
implementation ofscientific studies i.ebatch release ofdrugs, antiviral testing etc.
•Managing QAprojects onbehalf ofclients such asAstraZeneca, GlaxoSmithkline ,Novartis,
Roche and Boehringer Ingelheim .
•Meeting clients inperson (Lonza etc)toexplain and educate them about virology assays and
biologics inasimple manner tonon-scientists .
•Educating clients (Roche, Boehringer Ingelheim and others )onbiological material safety
testing processes carried outatMerck (Glasgow) onbehalf ofthecompany .
Oral and Written skills
•1stprizes fororal presentation attheCardiff School ofMedicine Postgraduate day and two
best poster prizes atInstitute meetings .Presented posters atinternational conferences
(British Society ofImmunology) .
•Best Poster Award atEuropean Conference ofImmunology, Amsterdam .
•United Nations Water and Sanitation presentation ,New Delhi, India .
•Published scientific findings inhigh impact factor journals such asBMJ (British Medical
Journal) and others .
Strategy Development onRapid Appraisal
•Inherent ability toasses and appraise complex situation involving cultural, biophysical and
technological aspects and design interventions appropriately .
•Ability tosimplify complex data setand information forgeneral scientific community
•-Science Fair organizer (Cardiff Univ .)Raising awareness ofrespiratory disease (2014 ,2015 )
•-Organizing committee and vice-president toeducate public onvaccine research, Imperial College (2017 -2019 )
•-Organised 3seminars tosellbiological safety testing ideas toAmerican pharma clients (Glasgow 2016 )
Project Management
•Managed and directed several Clinical trials involving infection models inhumans studying
anti-viral immunity atImperial College London
•Team leader insocial development programs facilitation inBangladesh and Uganda,
educating people inpoverty about water and sanitation management .Project aim:Reduce
waterborne disease and child mortality inthe developing world and toreduce faecal -oral
contamination .Fund

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
